title: Mandela House Museum
address: 8115 Vilakazi Street, Orlando West, Soweto, Johannesburg
description: The restored home of Nelson Mandela on Vilakazi Street, now a museum filled with memorabilia and history.

title: Hector Pieterson Museum
description: Memorial museum commemorating the 1976 Soweto uprising through photography and narrative exhibits.

title: Constitution Hill
description: Former prison complex turned Constitutional Court and museum telling South Africa’s journey to democracy.

title: Apartheid Museum
address: Northern Parkway & Gold Reef Road, Ormonde, Johannesburg
description: Interactive museum exploring South Africa’s apartheid history and pathway to reconciliation.

title: Carlton Centre (Top of Africa)
description: Once Africa’s tallest building, visit the 50th‑floor observation deck for panoramic views over Johannesburg.

title: Ponte City Apartments
description: Iconic cylindrical residential tower symbolic of Johannesburg’s urban history and transformation.

title: Nelson Mandela Bridge
address: Smit Street, connecting Braamfontein and Newtown, Johannesburg
description: Cable‑stayed bridge and city landmark, beautifully lit at night and linking cultural precincts.

title: Johannesburg Art Gallery
address: Klein & King George Streets, Joubert Park, Johannesburg
description: Home to one of Africa’s largest art collections, featuring local and international artworks.
